attributes.action: Slash the burden of red tape on employment law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Running a private business I now employ 8 full time people on emplyment law. 5 years ago that was zero.

Employers dont wake up one day and decide to sack someone. They have good reasons for the good of their business.

We supply supermarkets and it is very hard to make a living.

We need to be able to make management decisions freely.

I suggest the government protect basic human rights but leave it at that.

This would make UK PLC much more competitive and ironically would lead to more and better jobs for everyone.

The current law only protect lazy troublemakers and is disadvantaging the other 99.9% of the workforce.
